image_2.entity_name: Figure 2 Character level NN architecture for NER
image_2.description: The image illustrates the character-level neural network architecture for Named Entity Recognition (NER), showing how each character is processed through Bi-LSTM layers to predict labels.
image_2.reason: The image clearly depicts a character-level neural network architecture for NER, which aligns with the description provided in the text. The diagram shows the processing of characters through Bi-LSTM layers and the prediction of labels for each character.

image_3.entity_name: Figure 3 Word + character level NN architecture for NER
image_3.description: A neural network architecture that combines word-level and character-level features for named entity recognition (NER). The architecture includes a sequence of nodes representing different components of the model, with connections between word-level and character-level features, as well as label prediction nodes.
image_3.reason: The image clearly shows a detailed diagram of a word + character level neural network architecture for NER, which aligns with the description provided in the text. The diagram is divided into three main sections labeled B-ORG, I-ORG, and O, each containing a sequence of nodes representing different components of the model.

image_4.entity_name: Figure 4 Word+character+affix level NN architecture for NER
image_4.description: This model augments the character+word NN architecture with affixes, a feature from feature-engineering approaches. It learns affix embeddings alongside word embeddings and character RNNs.
image_4.reason: The image depicts a neural network model for Named Entity Recognition (NER) that includes components for processing words, characters, and affixes. This matches the description of the Word+character+affix level NN architecture for NER mentioned in the text.
